jobs.title: AI Developer Tooling Engineer
jobs.descriptionText:
Fanvue is the fastest-growing creator monetisation platform in the creator economy. We are the leading AI-powered creator-first platform, designed to empower creators worldwide to directly monetise their audience. Our platform supports creators with the tools they need to connect and monetise their audience in a scalable way.
We’re looking for an AI Developer Tooling Engineer focused on AI workflows that empower the development team and beyond. You will own and evolve the suite of internal AI development tools that power Fanvue, working closely with the engineering team to raise developer productivity and ship features faster.
What You'll Do:Design & build AI dev tooling – Create and maintain AI-centric developer tools, scripts, and workflows that streamline local and cloud development across the company.Integrate intelligent coding agents – Help other teammates leverage Cursor and/or Claude Code to accelerate day-to-day development; benchmark Aider, Cline, and GitHub Copilot whenever new features come out to see where they can add value.Operate MCP servers – Support the team in integrating Context 7, Puppeteer, MCP Compass and other MCP servers to optimise prompt routing and execution. Proactively assess emerging MCP servers and roll them out across the engineering organisation.Establish prompting best practices – Craft, document, and evangelise effective prompt patterns for a broad spectrum of engineering and product tasks.Author AI-ready documentation – Structure Markdown knowledge bases so that LLMs can ingest and answer questions on them reliably.
Who You Are: Must-havesSoftware engineering background with TypeScript in production environments.Hands-on expertise with AI coding agents: Cursor and Claude Code.Familiarity with AI dev tools such as CodeRabbit.Proven administration of Context 7, Puppeteer, and MCP Compass (or comparable) servers.Practical knowledge of Next.js and modern front-end tooling.Practical knowledge of Express.Deep understanding of core LLM concepts such as RAG pipelines, vector embeddings, fine-tuning methodologies, tokenization, and latency/throughput trade-offs.An understanding of the LLM model landscape and the strengths and weaknesses of the major models.Strong Git/GitHub workflow knowledge (PR review, CI/CD, trunk-based development).Demonstrable prompting mastery across diverse technical and creative domains.Solid grasp of secure coding practices: secrets management, least-privilege principles.Comfortable with local development environments – from installing dependencies and running local web servers to profiling performance and managing containerised stacks.
Nice-to-havesExperience building a project with AI using some of the skills outlined above.Experience with n8n.Experience with additional AI agents (Aider, Cline, GitHub Copilot).
Why Join Fanvue?Competitive salary and benefits packageWork with a talented, mission-driven team dedicated to empowering creators worldwideA culture that values innovation, ownership, transparency, and speedUnlimited holidayRemote workingFlexible hours, according to the times you perform bestBudget for growth and wellbeing

jobs.title: Senior Backend Engineer
jobs.descriptionText:
Who are we

At Lokalise, we make it easy and profitable for businesses to expand into new markets. Founded in 2017, our AI-powered translation and localization platform automates workflows, integrates with over 60 tools, and helps product teams launch multilingual products 10x faster and at 80% lower cost. Trusted by thousands of businesses across over 100 countries, Lokalise is empowering more than 25 million people worldwide to use diverse services in their native languages. Backed by a customer-loved support team, our platform seamlessly fits into your design and development processes, helping you scale effortlessly.

Location

While our company operates exclusively on a remote basis, you must reside and have the legal right to work in one of the following countries: the United Kingdom, Latvia, Spain, Germany, Denmark, Poland, Portugal, or Ireland.

This is a full-time, remote position. We do not offer B2B or contractor arrangements.

About

We're looking for a Senior Backend Engineer to join our Platform Domain. In this domain, we build foundational components of our technology stack, such as core services and the API gateway, with a focus on solving performance and scalability challenges. This domain is a key enabler for the rest of the engineering organisation and, ultimately, the quality of the user experience we offer.

In this role you will:

Lead the design, development, and deployment of complex software systems.Define technical standards, best practices, and coding guidelines that impact the entire engineering organisation.Architect scalable, robust, and efficient software solutions that define how our technology platform operates.Stay updated with emerging technologies and industry trends.Mentor other engineers, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement.Conduct code reviews and provide constructive feedback to ensure high-quality code.Contribute to technical discussions and decision-making processes.Promote a collaborative and inclusive team environment.

You must have:

7+ years of software development experience, with a focus on designing architecture for high performance and scalability.Proven experience leading engineering projects from design through rollout.A strong understanding of common modern technologies, including API best practices, message queues (RabbitMQ or similar), data stores (PostgreSQL or similar), and cloud services (AWS or similar).Experience working with multiple technology stacks, with a focus on Node.js (You'll find a range at Lokalise, from a PHP monolith to Node.js microservices). Proven experience in testing, including unit and integration testing.Strong problem-solving, analytical, and communication skills; effective collaborator in a fast-paced, remote startup environment.Passionate about learning and staying current with industry trends.

It is a plus if you have:

Experience driving platform changes and adoption across an engineering organization.Experience contributing to or maintaining open-source projects.Familiarity with the localization domain and software localization.

Our Benefits

Competitive salary and employee stock options planFully remote and flexible working hoursCo-working budgetFlexible vacation policyEquipment budget to set up your home officeLearning & Development programHealth insuranceWellness benefitsMental health support - every employee has access to a dedicated mental health platformGreat startup atmosphere, team spirit, and team events

We are committed to a culture of inclusion and equal opportunities. Therefore, we welcome applications from people of all gender identities, sexual orientations, personal expressions, relationship, marital, or civil partnership statuses, racial identities, national or ethnic origins, religious beliefs, ages, and disability statuses.

jobs.title: Customer Success Representative
jobs.descriptionText:
About Atarim

Atarim is a fast-growing, AI-fuelled SaaS company revolutionising how web agencies and hosting providers collaborate with clients. With 1.5 million users and counting, we streamline communication and slash project timelines, empowering thousands to work smarter, not harder. We're on a mission to dominate digital collaboration and we need your help to propel us to 1,000% growth!

Role Overview

As our new Customer Success Representative, you'll be the go-to person for our web agency customers, guiding them from onboarding through to renewal. You'll manage a large number of accounts ensuring each client gets maximum value from our product.

This is a hands-on, relationship-focused role ideal for someone who is in the earlier stages of their career and eager to grow further in SaaS and the digital agency space.

Requirements

What You'll Do

Onboard & Train new customers: Lead engaging onboarding sessions and product walkthroughs to set customers up for successDrive Adoption: Monitor usage, identify roadblocks, and proactively help customers achieve their goalsReduce Churn: Build strong relationships through regular check-ins, ensuring customers stay engaged and satisfiedExpand Accounts: Discover and execute on opportunities to grow your account's business with AtarimCollaborate Cross-Functionally: Work closely with Support and Product teams to surface bugs, suggest improvements, and relay customer feedbackChampion the Customer: Be the voice of the customer internally, advocating for their needs and success

The Ideal Candidate

Experience in a Customer Success or Account Management role, ideally at a SaaS companyExperience managing multiple customer accounts simultaneously and with precisionComfortable using tools such as Slack, G Suite, and CRM platformsStrong communication skills with fluency in both written and spoken EnglishAgile and proactive with an emphasis on helping customers winBachelor's degree in a relevant discipline, or equivalent experienceUK-based preferred, or committed to working UK / European hours

Bonus Points

Familiarity with Figma, WordPress, HubSpot, or ConfluenceExperience in the web agency or web hosting industryUnderstanding of the web development cycle, along with related tools and solutionsExperience using AI to increase work productivityFluency in a second language. 

Benefits

Why Join Atarim?

Impact at Scale: Be part of a high-impact team that's shaping the future of digital collaborationRemote-First Flexibility: Work from anywhere with a culture that values autonomy, ownership, and bold ideasDynamic Team: Join a supportive, innovative crew passionate about redefining collaboration for agencies and teams worldwideCompetitive Compensation: Enjoy a strong starting salary with target-driven bonuses and the chance to grow with a rapidly scaling SaaS company

Ready To Grow With Us?

If you thrive in a high-touch, high-impact environment and love turning curious users into loyal, knowledgeable champions, then we want you! Apply now to help us shape the future of creative collaboration.

jobs.title: Product Designer
jobs.descriptionText:
About Paydock:Paydock is a leading payment orchestration platform, empowering businesses to simplify complex payment processes, enhance security, and optimize their payment strategies. We provide a robust, flexible, and innovative solution that integrates with multiple payment providers, helping our clients reduce costs, increase conversion, and gain deeper insights into their payment ecosystem. At Paydock, we're passionate about creating intuitive and powerful tools that redefine how businesses manage their payments.
The Opportunity:We are looking for a talented and passionate Product Designer to join our growing team. As a Product Designer at Paydock, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the user experience of our cutting-edge payment orchestration platform. You will be responsible for understanding user needs, translating complex requirements into intuitive designs, and working collaboratively with product managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to deliver exceptional products that delight our users.This is an exciting opportunity for a designer who thrives in a fast-paced, agile environment and is eager to make a significant impact on a product used by businesses worldwide.
Key Responsibilities:User Research & Understanding: Conduct user research, including interviews, surveys, and usability testing, to deeply understand user behaviors, needs, and pain points within the payment landscape.Concept & Ideation: Translate user research and business requirements into innovative design concepts, user flows, wireframes, and prototypes.Design Execution: Create high-fidelity mockups and visual designs that adhere to our brand guidelines and design system, ensuring a consistent and delightful user experience across all touchpoints.Collaboration: Work closely with Product Managers to define product requirements and roadmaps, and collaborate with Engineers to ensure technical feasibility and successful implementation of designs.Prototyping & Testing: Develop interactive prototypes to test design concepts and gather feedback, iterating on designs based on user feedback and analytical data.Design System Contribution: Contribute to the evolution and maintenance of our design system, ensuring consistency, scalability, and efficiency in our design processes.Advocacy: Champion user-centered design principles throughout the organization, fostering a culture of empathy and innovation.Communication: Clearly articulate design decisions, rationale, and trade-offs to various stakeholders, both verbally and visually.
What You'll Bring:5 years of experience as a Product Designer, UX Designer, or similar role, preferably in a SaaS, FinTech, or B2B product environment.A strong portfolio showcasing your end-to-end design process, problem-solving skills, and a keen eye for detail.Proficiency with design and prototyping tools (e.g., Figma, Sketch, Adobe XD, etc)Solid understanding of user-centered design principles, information architecture, and usability best practices.Experience conducting user research and translating insights into actionable design solutions.Excellent communication, collaboration, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to articulate design decisions effectively.A passion for solving complex problems and creating elegant, intuitive solutions.
Bonus Points If You Have:Experience with payment systems, financial technology, or e-commerce platforms.Familiarity with front-end development technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) to better understand technical constraints.Experience working with or contributing to a mature design system.

company.name: Paydock
company.description:
Paydock is an innovative payment orchestration platform that enables financial institutions, digital merchants, B2B platforms and not-for-profit organisations to increase revenue and efficiency while substantially reducing costs.

Key Highlights
- Regain ownership, flexibility and control of payment systems
- Improved customer/donor experience
- Simplified payment integrations both now and into the future

Started in Australia and since expanded into the UK, PayDock is the result of 11 years of analysis and working closely with merchants to identify their payment needs and opportunities within digital strategy.

For the last 3 years we’ve been forging a new type of payment service. A payment orchestration platform that lets you take payments the way you want, take advantage of new services and grow your business without being trapped. 

Our roots in the impact sector means we understand the need to bring ultimate efficiency in all areas of operation while helping you tell your story in the most compelling way possible. 

PayDock reduces cost, increases conversions and opens up new possibilities of customer engagement. Get in touch to find out how we can add value to your business and help you grow.

jobs.title: Lead Industrial Product Designer [349]
jobs.descriptionText:
About the Company:Manta Sleep - was founded in 2016, and their team specializes in creating innovative sleep accessories designed to enhance sleep quality. Their flagship products include a variety of sleep masks and sleep accessories, all engineered to provide perfect sleep conditions for their users. The company is a strong advocate for the Pro-Nap Movement, promoting the benefits of regular napping and challenging traditional corporate norms that discourage rest during work hours. Their mission centers on empowering individuals to unlock their full potential through better sleep, offering products that cater to various sleep needs and preferences.
About the Role:We are looking to hire a mature and experienced Lead Industrial Product Designer who will be responsible for shaping the company’s product vision and leading the design team to create innovative sleep products that resonate with customers. You will work hands-on in a fast-growing e-commerce environment, balancing strategic planning with execution while managing a small but expanding team of designers and product managers.
The role requires a deep understanding of user needs, ensuring that each product launched not only meets high design standards but also drives business growth. Collaboration is key, as you will work closely with product design, marketing, and report directly to leadership to bring products to market successfully. With a global team spread across Europe and Asia, the candidate must be adaptable and capable of leading design efforts in a highly dynamic, entrepreneurial setting.
This is a Full-Time remote role.Salary Range: 70- 100k USD annually
We are looking for a Lead Industrial Product Designer specifically with these requirements:
Ideally, 5-10 years of experience in a Product Design role, having both hands-on and leadership experience.Previous experience in a smaller to mid-sized E-commerce business, with at least a $30M-$50M revenue.Experience designing soft products or similar (home or textile goods) is a must.Proven track record of building and managing small design teams.Ability to plan for product launches over the next 3+ years.Understanding of how to create products that customers love and that are feasible from the engineering side.Experience working closely with the product and marketing teams, and with external agencies when needed.Comfortable making decisions in a fast-paced environment with limited corporate infrastructure.Experience working with international teams across different time zones.Open to occasional travel, especially to Asia, for product development purposes.Strong communication and leadership skills, while being able to find a good balance between creative ideas and feasible solutions.

Your responsibility will include (but not limited to):
Develop and implement a long-term product design strategy aligned with business growth objectives.Be directly involved in design processes, from concept to launch, ensuring a balance of vision and execution.Oversee the design and launch of products that drive customer engagement and sales.Build, manage, and mentor a growing team of designers and product managers.Foster a hands-on, collaborative environment where creativity and efficiency thrive.Work closely with the product, marketing, and leadership team to bring products to market successfully.Ensure seamless coordination between design, production, engineering and marketing efforts.Iterate on product design based on user feedback, data, and market trends.Stay updated on design trends, customer preferences, and industry innovations.Use data-driven insights to enhance product design and user experience.Occasional travel to Asia - approx 3 times a year for product development and production coordination.
Growth Opportunities/Perks:
Freedom and control over your schedule.Open and transparent workplace.Freedom to be creative and own your work.No office politics or bureaucracyGreat growth opportunities and training resources.Unlimited vacation and sick leave days.
This Position Is Perfect For You If…
You're a visionary problem solver.You won’t be expected to have all the answers from day one, but you’ll need to think strategically, adapt quickly, and drive innovative product designs that align with business goals.
You're highly organized and hands-on.You can balance big-picture vision with hands-on execution, ensuring that design projects move forward smoothly while leading and growing a small, agile team.
You're passionate about creating products people love.You understand the intersection of design, functionality, and customer needs, ensuring that every product developed is not just well-designed but also highly desirable and marketable.

Our hiring process is made up of four parts, so please be aware that you will need to dedicate time for a questionnaire, a video, and two 1-on-1 interviews.Thank you for taking the time to consider this position. I look forward to hearing from you soon!

jobs.title: Product Designer
jobs.descriptionText:
Veyor is a leading SaaS platform revolutionising delivery and dock management in the construction and commercial real estate sectors. Our mission is to streamline the coordination of deliveries, contractors, and facilities teams, enhancing efficiency and reducing friction in site operations. Trusted by top-tier property managers, construction superintendents, and facility operators, we are expanding our global footprint and seeking a Product Designer to join our remote team.

The Role

We’re seeking a Product Designer to join a fast-growing, remote-first SaaS team transforming operations in construction and facility management. You will be responsible for creating intuitive, scalable, and user-centered design solutions across our platform. From research and ideation to high-fidelity design and developer handoff, you'll own the end-to-end design process and help craft a cohesive and efficient user experience that meets the needs of industry professionals in construction, civil infrastructure, and Class A facilities.

Responsibilities

Leading the full product design process for new features and improvements.Conducting user interviews, usability testing, and analysing data to validate and inform design decisions.Creating and maintaining a scalable design system to ensure UI/UX consistency.Collaborating with product managers, engineers, and stakeholders to align on business goals and user needs.Advocating for user experience excellence and fostering a strong design culture across the team.Stay abreast of the latest design methodologies, tools, and industry trends to enhance your skill setApply new knowledge to drive innovation within our platform, improving user experiences across construction, civil, and facility management sectors.

Ideal Profile

You have 4+ years of experience in product design with a portfolio that highlights user-centered solutions and cross-functional collaboration.You have experience designing for SaaS platforms, preferably in logistics, construction, or facilities management.You are highly skilled in Figma, Sketch, or Adobe XD.You are proficient in using quantitative methods to inform and support design decisions.Prior experience leveraging AI to enhance UX, using data/analytics in design decisions, and a background in Design, UX, HCI, or a related field would be advantageous. You have a strong understanding of responsive design and accessibility best practices.You are a clear communicator who collaborates well in remote, cross-functional teams.You are fluent in English, both written and verbal.You bring a growth mindset and are proactive about staying current with design trends and tools.

What's on Offer?

Join a high-growth B2B SaaS start-up driving innovation in construction & facility managementBe part of a supportive and collaborative team that values design excellenceMake a tangible impact on a global product

jobs.title: Designers with Experience in 3DX and CPD
jobs.descriptionText:
CT Engineering Group UK Ltd is a part of the CT Engineering Group, a leading engineering service provider in Europe and several additional countries worldwide. With headquarters in Madrid, the group has more than 1700 engineers and works with over 200 blue chip industrial companies in various sectors including aeronautical, automotive, railway, naval, Industrial plants and renewable energy. CT are a Tier One E2S supplier to Airbus and have a pan European presence as part of the CT Engineering Group.

We are looking for two talented and experienced designers to join our team for research projects. The selected candidates will work remotely on the creation and verification of models for the A350 and A400M aircraft.

 Senior Designer

Requirements:

 Proven experience in 3DX and CPD. Previous experience with A350 or A400M models. Drawing checker status for A350 or A400M.

Responsibilities:

 Lead and supervise the design and verification of models. Collaborate with the research team to ensure the accuracy and quality of designs.

Conditions:

 Initial three-month contract with the possibility of extension. Remote work. Junior Designer

Requirements:

 Experience in 3DX and CPD. Preferably experience with A350 or A400M models.

 Assist in the design and development of models. Collaborate with the design team to meet project objectives.

Conditions:

 Initial three-month contract with the possibility of extension. Remote work.

 British nationality (preferred due to project funding requirements). Availability to work from anywhere in the UK.

Benefits:

 Opportunity to work on innovative and high-impact projects. Flexibility of remote work. Possibility of contract extension and professional growth.

company.name: THE CT ENGINEERING GROUP
company.description:
CT is an international engineering company eager to help its clients succeed in their technological projects. 

From product design engineering to manufacturing engineering, after-sales engineering support and R&D projects, we operate in the aeronautic, space, marine, automotive, railway, energy, industrial plants and architecture sectors.

Every day, our engineers work side by side with customers in all engineering activities across the product lifecycle. Each one of them thrives to understand client needs and provide solutions, while maintaining an easy and enjoyable customer experience.  CT’s success is driven by more than 2,000 talented employees based in nine countries, spanning three continents.

At CT, we enjoy helping clients achieve their goals, and we see barriers as opportunities.  We are engineers that love engineering challenges.

jobs.title: Product Manager - NEC Housing
jobs.descriptionText:
Come join us and make a difference in the world!
Discover more at www.necsws.com
NO AGENCIES PLEASE
Job Description
*** Please note - Hybrid or remote subject to location ***
Join us on an exhilarating journey as a Product Manager for NEC Housing, where you'll play a pivotal role in shaping and delivering cutting-edge products for the Social Housing sector. We are investing over £8m per annum in our market-leading award-winning solutions that support our customers to deliver better services, more effectively.
We're looking for candidates to be part of a dynamic team focused on exceeding customer expectations, maximising intellectual property, and revolutionising the sector!From market assessment through to requirements decomposition, support of build and final test verification, you'll be focused on ensuring that the NEC Housing platform supports our customers meet the challenges they face.
Responsibilities:
Carry out market research to understand legislative, regulatory, competitive, economic landscape, as well as changing market drivers for your business process areas.Become the expert in your product area, with the ability to deal with queries from customers and internal stakeholders.Collaborate with customers through co-design workshops, user group sessions and customer meetings to fully understand what’s happening in the sector and how this influences customer requirements.Define customer business needs and objectives to ensure that NEC Housing products and solutions meet or exceed customer/market expectations.Define requirements, user stories and wireframes for new product developments and work closely with the development and QA teams to ensure the delivery of solutions that achieve customer outcomes.Work with Technical Authors to produce / review product documentation.Build business cases to define market uptake, pricing and margin analysis.Identify any 3rd party requirements to complete the user requirements. Liaise and manage requirements with 3rd party suppliers, systems integrators or other organisations as required.Define the roadmap for your product area(s).Assist the Pre-Sales/Sales team with the production, review and management of bid responses, sales proposals and quotations, as required.Produce and deliver presentations for both customer and internal audiences.Support product launch activities.
This is your chance to shape and influence NEC Housing products while guiding customers toward best practices. Future opportunities for growth and progression within the Product Team or the wider business await the successful candidate. Join us now and make a lasting impact in the Housing sector!
Qualifications
Essential:
Experience in UK Social Housing, either as a customer or software solution provider.Strong knowledge of project life-cycle, methodologies, and delivering projects on time and budget.Experience in defining product enhancements, UI/UX design, and Agile new product development.Experience with housing management systems or related software.Excellent presentation and communication skills.
Desirable:
Proven ability to build relationships and understand client perspectives.Effective time management and resource allocation.Strong decision-making skills.Full, valid UK/EC driving license for travel.Experience in end-to-end product life cycle management.Experience of designing digital solutions for the social housing sector, including mobile apps and web platforms.Proficiency in tools like Figma, JIRA.

We pride ourselves in offering an excellent benefits package, including an above average pension scheme. When you join the team at NEC Software Solutions, you are provided with the following:
Private Medical Cover funded by NEC for Employees (with the option to add family members at an additional cost)25 days paid holiday with the option to buy/sell (FTE)4 x basic salary life assurance cover funded by NEC (with the option to increase cover at an additional cost)A Group Pension Plan with fantastic employer contributions up to a maximum of 8.5%A selection of flexible benefits to suit your individual needsAll colleagues get free access to LinkedIn Learning. Over 15000 courses covering a huge breadth of subjects. Learn about what you like, when you like, how you like.

Documentary evidence will be required.All offers are subject to satisfactory vetting, references and occupational health checks. NEC Software Solutions is an equal opportunities employer, welcoming applications from all communities. If you require any reasonable adjustments or have specific accessibility needs during the recruitment or interview process, please feel free to share these with us. We’re NEC Software Solutions (part of global tech giant NEC Corporation). While you read this ad, our software is helping to dispatch ambulances, support families, keep trains on the move, locate missing people and even test the hearing of newborn babies.
Working with us, you’ll be helping our 3,000+ employees push the boundaries of what’s possible and support amazing public services.

We help them pay financial support faster, speed up treatments for patients and respond to emergencies in the right way. The more we do, the more our customers can do for others. And together, we make a world of difference.

jobs.title: Senior UI Technical Designer | North America | Canada | Europe | Fully Remote
jobs.descriptionText:
What We are looking for:

We are looking for a Senior Technical UI Designer to join our team, specializing in building and implementing UI systems in-engine with a technical and artistic sensibility. This role bridges the gap between UI art and in-game functionality, ensuring UI concepts translate smoothly into interactive, shippable experiences.

Requirements

What You Will Do:

Implement UI elements, menus, widgets, and HUDs directly in Unreal Engine 5 ensuring high-quality presentation and usabilityPrototype and iterate on UI interactions to refine user experience and optimize responsiveness in-gameWork closely with engineers to hook up UI elements to game systems intelligently, ensuring seamless interaction between UI and gameplay mechanicsEvaluate and improve UI workflows by suggesting and prototyping tools and pipeline improvementsCollaborate with UI/UX designers, game designers, and engineers to design, test, and refine UI systems and ensure an efficient integration processContribute to UI animation and motion design, ensuring polished, smooth transitions and feedback mechanisms for playersWork alongside both in-house and outsourced artists to bring UI designs from concept to final implementation

What you will bring:

Expertise in UI implementation in Unreal Engine 5 (or similar game engines), including Blueprint scripting and working with UI-related systems like UMGAbility to translate static UI concepts into interactive, functional, and shippable assets, maintaining high quality and performanceExperience prototyping and refining UI interactions, focusing on fluidity, clarity, and user feedbackExperience with animation and motion design for UI elements to enhance engagement and usabilityStrong problem-solving skills and the ability to proactively identify solutionsA collaborative and iterative mindset, able to receive feedback and refine designsProficiency in Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, or other UI/UX design tools, with an emphasis on bringing designs into a game engine

Benefits

Interested... a bit about Escape Velocity:

Escape Velocity is a team of passionate, talented developers working at a studio that offers excellent benefits, on what we believe is a unique project with a committed publisher. But that doesn't necessarily make us unique. What does make us special? We value the time, energy, and talent of our players and our colleagues. We want every hour spent developing and playing our games to be an incredibly rewarding and worthwhile use of your time.

To that end, we are ‘Fully Remote' and support team members nearly anywhere in the world. We prioritize honesty, even when that means sharing bad news. We strive to give everyone autonomy so they can determine how best to work and play, and we care more about what you bring to the game and studio than how many hours you're clocking. We're dedicated to building a culture of play, which not only makes us better game makers, but also strengthens the bonds between us all. We believe in constant improvement across all areas - from the game itself to our production design - and are constantly re-evaluating how we spend our time to ensure that we're not wasting yours and we're all always working on the most important things.

A few benefits you can expect from us:

A generous PTO allowanceSummer and Winter holidays studio closure (separate to PTO allowance)Private Medical & Dental Healthcare Private Mental Health scheme A generous annual Health & Wellbeing allowanceDiscretionary Studio BonusTop range tech for your home set upOther benefits based on your region

How to apply:

Click apply and complete an application along with a Resume / CV. If we would like to move forward with your application, a member of the Recruiting Team will reach out to you and guide you through our process.

Escape Velocity is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to hiring, promoting, and compensating employees based on their qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities.

Applications will be considered regardless of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, belief, race, or any other protected category.

jobs.title: UI Engineering Manager
jobs.descriptionText:
UI Engineering ManagerFixed term: Full TimeTime zone: U.K Location: Remote
***This role is an engineering role and not related to user experience.
As the UI engineering manager for Flexera’s Engineering global UI team, you will be a leader that drives UI strategy and roadmap deliveries across the UI environment of our application that solves real and challenging industry problems for our customers.
Flexera gives companies clarity into their technology “black hole,” helping business leaders turn IT insight into action. With a portfolio of integrated solutions and products that deliver unparalleled technology insights, spend optimization and agility, Flexera helps enterprises realize IT’s full potential to accelerate their business.
As manager of Flexera’s global UI team, you will be leading a highly experienced team of UI engineers that are building and transforming products within Flexera’s suite. You will get insight to cloud, big data infrastructure and lead the team to continue building out UI capabilities to support Flexera’s architecture.
We are developing with some of the most modern front-end technologies, including React, TypeScript and Styled Components, working closely with Flexera’s design and product teams to continue to build on our “one source of truth” design system using Storybook.
Our products will give customers the visibility they need to be prepared for financial, operational and security events. The UI team have been building clean and smart UI for these areas over several years and are looking for a UI engineering manager to aid their priorities and objectives as we look ahead.
The Role:
As an Engineering Manager, you’ll be responsible for the workload management, wellbeing, and professional growth of the engineers on your team. You’ll help foster an open and collaborative environment and support systems to help your team succeed.
You will be leading the Platform UI team within Platform Engineering, which is at the heart of the UI architecture and build of the front-end systems powering our platforms. You will be working in cross-product group collaborations, working closely with the UX Design team and product managers, and supporting our engineering teams to deliver the best possible experience for our customers.
Your Responsibilities:
Lead the platform UI team.
This team manages the following UI engineering responsibilities:UI architecture, application infrastructure and dev operationsUI systems using UI frameworks, TypeScript packages, and third-party tooling integrations.User interaction and web components/design systemUI best practice patterns, quality, and complianceUI observability and support SLOsManage team workload, feature roadmap resourcing & coordination in a fast-paced, highly distributed environment.Maintain visibility into the product roadmap objectives and share that information back to other managers and team members.Participate in team activities, such as roadmap planning, to prioritize features on the roadmap based on availability of humans to do the work and business objectives that need to be met.Support wellbeing of team members - providing support & guidance focused primarily on resourcing, technical progression, and soft skills.Gather feedback from others, provide coaching weekly & in collaboration with senior/staff engineers to advance team member skill sets.Recruitment - leading and coordinating recruitment process from initial contact to offer.Budgets - manage engineering tooling budget and renewals with procurement and finance teams.Support mentorship on technical upskilling and training UI engineers’ career pathsHave fun solving difficult problems and managing high priorities across a broad range of customer requests.

The skills you’ll need:
Experience planning, tracking, delivering, and managing multiple projects at any one time.Strong engineering track-record focusing on front-end development & technologies (JS/TS/CSS/HTML), modern frameworks, maintaining UI quality and UI engineering best practices.Experience of operating a service at scale with observability and reporting on engineering metricsExperience with front end frameworks such as React, AngularExperience with Accessibility (a11y) best practices, tools, and techniques such as compatibility with keyboard navigation, screen readers and WCAG guidelinesExperience with internationalization (i18n) and atomic designExperience providing business cases and proposals to Flexera’s senior leadership team.Strong communication skills in both verbal and written formatsBeing an advocate UX consistency, accessibility, and empathy for the end userExperience mentoring & supporting people and teams with empathy & professionalism.A good understanding of Cloud Technologies, big data, and SaaS products.High experience in business analysis experience to communicate comfortable with Product Managers and UX Designers for requirement analysis and driving the engineering team to come up with solution approach and design for delivering the requirements.
Bonus Points: Experience in remote-first environments and global teamsFamiliarity with Performance testingFamiliarity with AWS and Azure infrastructure

company.name: Flexera
company.description:
Flexera helps organizations understand and maximize the value of their technology, saving billions of dollars in wasted spend. Powered by the Flexera Technology Intelligence Platform, our award-winning IT asset management, FinOps and SaaS management solutions provide comprehensive visibility and actionable insights on an organization’s entire IT ecosystem. This intelligence enables IT, finance, procurement and cloud teams to address skyrocketing costs, optimize spend, mitigate risk and identify opportunities to create positive business outcomes. 
 
More than 50,000 global organizations rely on Flexera and its Technopedia reference library, the largest repository of technology asset data. Learn more at flexera.com.
